Simon Cowell was a company man, a traditional A&R rep who rose quickly through the ranks at big record labels by focusing on profits over cultural cachet. While most of my colleagues were obsessed with signing the next coolest rock or alternative band, he wrote in his 2003 memoir, Simon Cowell scored massive hits with records based on WrestleMania, Teletubbies, and the Mighty Morphin Power Rangers.
